trans-unit.source: Compliance policy settings for Windows devices| Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Compliance policy settings for Windows devices| Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Compliance policy settings for Windows devices in Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Compliance policy settings for Windows devices in Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: The policy settings described in this topic applies to devices running the Windows operating system.
trans-unit.target: The policy settings described in this topic applies to devices running the Windows operating system.

trans-unit.source: The specific Windows version supported is called out in the sections below.
trans-unit.target: The specific Windows version supported is called out in the sections below.

trans-unit.source: If you are looking for information about other platforms, select one of the following:
trans-unit.target: If you are looking for information about other platforms, select one of the following:

trans-unit.source: [Compliance policy settings for iOS devices](ios-compliance-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune.md)
trans-unit.target: [Compliance policy settings for iOS devices](ios-compliance-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune.md)

trans-unit.source: [Compliance policy settings for Android devices](android-compliance-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune.md)
trans-unit.target: [Compliance policy settings for Android devices](android-compliance-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune.md)

trans-unit.source: Compliance policy settings for Windows Phone devices
trans-unit.target: Compliance policy settings for Windows Phone devices

trans-unit.source: The settings listed in this section are supported on Windows Phone 8.1 and later.
trans-unit.target: The settings listed in this section are supported on Windows Phone 8.1 and later.

trans-unit.source: System security settings
trans-unit.target: System security settings

trans-unit.source: Password
trans-unit.target: Password

trans-unit.source: **Require a password to unlock mobile devices:** Set this to **Yes** to require users to enter a password before they can access their device.
trans-unit.target: **Require a password to unlock mobile devices:** Set this to **Yes** to require users to enter a password before they can access their device.

trans-unit.source: **Allow simple passwords:** Set this to **Yes** to let users create simple passwords such as ‘**1234**’ or ‘**1111**’.
trans-unit.target: **Allow simple passwords:** Set this to **Yes** to let users create simple passwords such as ‘**1234**’ or ‘**1111**’.

trans-unit.source: **Minimum password length:** Specify the minimum number of digits or characters that the user’s password must contain.
trans-unit.target: **Minimum password length:** Specify the minimum number of digits or characters that the user’s password must contain.

trans-unit.source: **Required password type:** Specify whether users must create an **Alphanumeric**, or a **Numeric** password.
trans-unit.target: **Required password type:** Specify whether users must create an **Alphanumeric**, or a **Numeric** password.

trans-unit.source: For devices that run Windows and accessed with a Microsoft account, the compliance policy will fail to evaluate correctly if minimum password length is greater than eight characters or if minimum number of character sets is more than two.
trans-unit.target: For devices that run Windows and accessed with a Microsoft account, the compliance policy will fail to evaluate correctly if minimum password length is greater than eight characters or if minimum number of character sets is more than two.

trans-unit.source: **Minimum number of character sets:** If **Required password type** is set to **Alphanumeric**, this setting specifies the minimum number of character sets that the password must contain.
trans-unit.target: **Minimum number of character sets:** If **Required password type** is set to **Alphanumeric**, this setting specifies the minimum number of character sets that the password must contain.

trans-unit.source: The four character sets are:
trans-unit.target: The four character sets are:

trans-unit.source: Lowercase letters
trans-unit.target: Lowercase letters

trans-unit.source: Uppercase letters
trans-unit.target: Uppercase letters

trans-unit.source: Symbols
trans-unit.target: Symbols

trans-unit.source: Numbers
trans-unit.target: Numbers

trans-unit.source: Setting a higher number for this setting will require users to create passwords that are more complex.
trans-unit.target: Setting a higher number for this setting will require users to create passwords that are more complex.

trans-unit.source: For devices that run Windows and accessed with a Microsoft account, the compliance policy will fail to evaluate correctly if minimum password length is greater than eight characters or if minimum number of character sets is more than two.
trans-unit.target: For devices that run Windows and accessed with a Microsoft account, the compliance policy will fail to evaluate correctly if minimum password length is greater than eight characters or if minimum number of character sets is more than two.

trans-unit.source: **Minutes of inactivity before password is required:** Specifies the idle time before the user must re-enter their password.
trans-unit.target: **Minutes of inactivity before password is required:** Specifies the idle time before the user must re-enter their password.

trans-unit.source: **Password expiration (days):** Select the number of days before the user’s password expires and they must create a new one.
trans-unit.target: **Password expiration (days):** Select the number of days before the user’s password expires and they must create a new one.

trans-unit.source: **Remember password history:** Use this setting in conjunction with **Prevent reuse of previous passwords** to restrict the user from creating previously used passwords.
trans-unit.target: **Remember password history:** Use this setting in conjunction with **Prevent reuse of previous passwords** to restrict the user from creating previously used passwords.

trans-unit.source: **Prevent reuse of previous passwords:** If **Remember password history** is selected, specify the number of previously used passwords that cannot be re-used.
trans-unit.target: **Prevent reuse of previous passwords:** If **Remember password history** is selected, specify the number of previously used passwords that cannot be re-used.

trans-unit.source: **Require a password when the device returns from an idle state:** This setting should be used together with the **Minutes of inactivity before password is required** setting.
trans-unit.target: **Require a password when the device returns from an idle state:** This setting should be used together with the **Minutes of inactivity before password is required** setting.

trans-unit.source: The end users are prompted to enter a password to access a device that has been inactive for the time specified in the **Minutes of inactivity before password is required** setting.
trans-unit.target: The end users are prompted to enter a password to access a device that has been inactive for the time specified in the **Minutes of inactivity before password is required** setting.

trans-unit.source: **This setting only applies to Windows 10 Mobile devices.**
trans-unit.target: **This setting only applies to Windows 10 Mobile devices.**

trans-unit.source: Encryption
trans-unit.target: Encryption

trans-unit.source: **Require encryption on mobile device:** Set this to **Yes** to require the device to be encrypted in order to connect to resources.
trans-unit.target: **Require encryption on mobile device:** Set this to **Yes** to require the device to be encrypted in order to connect to resources.

trans-unit.source: Device health settings
trans-unit.target: Device health settings

trans-unit.source: **Require devices to be reported as healthy:** You can set a rule to require that **Windows 10 Mobile** devices must be reported as healthy in new or existing Compliance Policies.
trans-unit.target: **Require devices to be reported as healthy:** You can set a rule to require that **Windows 10 Mobile** devices must be reported as healthy in new or existing Compliance Policies.

trans-unit.source: If this setting is enabled, Windows 10 devices are evaluated via the Health Attestation Service (HAS) for the following data points:
trans-unit.target: If this setting is enabled, Windows 10 devices are evaluated via the Health Attestation Service (HAS) for the following data points:

trans-unit.source: **BitLocker is enabled:** When BitLocker is on, the device is able to protect data that is stored on the drive from unauthorized access, when the system is turned off or goes to hibernation.
trans-unit.target: **BitLocker is enabled:** When BitLocker is on, the device is able to protect data that is stored on the drive from unauthorized access, when the system is turned off or goes to hibernation.

trans-unit.source: Windows BitLocker Drive Encryption encrypts all data stored on the Windows operating system volume.
trans-unit.target: Windows BitLocker Drive Encryption encrypts all data stored on the Windows operating system volume.

trans-unit.source: BitLocker uses the TPM to help protect the Windows operating system and user data and helps to ensure that a computer is not tampered with, even if it is left unattended, lost, or stolen.
trans-unit.target: BitLocker uses the TPM to help protect the Windows operating system and user data and helps to ensure that a computer is not tampered with, even if it is left unattended, lost, or stolen.

trans-unit.source: If the computer is equipped with a compatible TPM, BitLocker uses the TPM to lock the encryption keys that protect the data.
trans-unit.target: If the computer is equipped with a compatible TPM, BitLocker uses the TPM to lock the encryption keys that protect the data.

trans-unit.source: As a result, the keys cannot be accessed until the TPM has verified the state of the computer
trans-unit.target: As a result, the keys cannot be accessed until the TPM has verified the state of the computer

trans-unit.source: **Code integrity is enabled:** Code integrity is a feature that validates the integrity of a driver or system file each time it is loaded into memory.
trans-unit.target: **Code integrity is enabled:** Code integrity is a feature that validates the integrity of a driver or system file each time it is loaded into memory.

trans-unit.source: Code integrity detects whether an unsigned driver or system file is being loaded into the kernel, or whether a system file has been modified by malicious software that is being run by a user account with administrator privileges.
trans-unit.target: Code integrity detects whether an unsigned driver or system file is being loaded into the kernel, or whether a system file has been modified by malicious software that is being run by a user account with administrator privileges.

trans-unit.source: **Secure Boot is enabled:** When Secure Boot is enabled, the system is forced to boot to a factory trusted state.
trans-unit.target: **Secure Boot is enabled:** When Secure Boot is enabled, the system is forced to boot to a factory trusted state.

trans-unit.source: Also, when Secure Boot is enabled, the core components used to boot the machine must have correct cryptographic signatures that are trusted by the organization that manufactured the device.
trans-unit.target: Also, when Secure Boot is enabled, the core components used to boot the machine must have correct cryptographic signatures that are trusted by the organization that manufactured the device.

trans-unit.source: The UEFI firmware verifies this before it lets the machine start.
trans-unit.target: The UEFI firmware verifies this before it lets the machine start.

trans-unit.source: If any files have been tampered with, breaking their signature, the system will not boot.
trans-unit.target: If any files have been tampered with, breaking their signature, the system will not boot.

trans-unit.source: For information on how the HAS service works, see [Health Attestation CSP](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn934876.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For information on how the HAS service works, see [Health Attestation CSP](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn934876.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Device property settings
trans-unit.target: Device property settings

trans-unit.source: **Minimum OS required:** When a device does not meet the minimum OS version requirement, it is reported as noncompliant.
trans-unit.target: **Minimum OS required:** When a device does not meet the minimum OS version requirement, it is reported as noncompliant.

trans-unit.source: A link with information on how to upgrade is displayed.
trans-unit.target: A link with information on how to upgrade is displayed.

trans-unit.source: The end user can choose to upgrade their device after which they can access company resources.
trans-unit.target: The end user can choose to upgrade their device after which they can access company resources.

trans-unit.source: **Maximum OS version allowed:** When a device is using an OS version later than the one specified in the rule, access to company resources is blocked and the user is asked to contact their IT admin.
trans-unit.target: **Maximum OS version allowed:** When a device is using an OS version later than the one specified in the rule, access to company resources is blocked and the user is asked to contact their IT admin.

trans-unit.source: Until there is a change in rule to allow the OS version, this device cannot be used to access company resources.
trans-unit.target: Until there is a change in rule to allow the OS version, this device cannot be used to access company resources.

trans-unit.source: Compliance policy settings for Windows PCs
trans-unit.target: Compliance policy settings for Windows PCs

trans-unit.source: The settings listed in this section are supported on Windows PCs.
trans-unit.target: The settings listed in this section are supported on Windows PCs.

trans-unit.source: System security settings
trans-unit.target: System security settings

trans-unit.source: Password
trans-unit.target: Password

trans-unit.source: **Minimum password length:** - Supported on Windows 8.1.
trans-unit.target: **Minimum password length:** - Supported on Windows 8.1.

trans-unit.source: Specify the minimum number of digits or characters that the user’s password must contain.
trans-unit.target: Specify the minimum number of digits or characters that the user’s password must contain.

trans-unit.source: For devices that are accessed with a Microsoft Account, the compliance policy will fail to evaluate correctly if **Minimum password length** is greater than 8 characters or if **Minimum number of character sets** is more than two characters.
trans-unit.target: For devices that are accessed with a Microsoft Account, the compliance policy will fail to evaluate correctly if **Minimum password length** is greater than 8 characters or if **Minimum number of character sets** is more than two characters.

trans-unit.source: **Required password type:** - Supported on Windows RT, Windows RT 8.1, and Windows 8.1
trans-unit.target: **Required password type:** - Supported on Windows RT, Windows RT 8.1, and Windows 8.1

trans-unit.source: Specify whether users must create an **Alphanumeric**, or a **Numeric** password.
trans-unit.target: Specify whether users must create an **Alphanumeric**, or a **Numeric** password.

trans-unit.source: **Minimum number of character sets:** - Supported on Windows RT, Windows RT 8.1, and Windows 8.1.
trans-unit.target: **Minimum number of character sets:** - Supported on Windows RT, Windows RT 8.1, and Windows 8.1.

trans-unit.source: If **Required password type** is set to **Alphanumeric**, this setting specifies the minimum number of character sets that the password must contain.
trans-unit.target: If **Required password type** is set to **Alphanumeric**, this setting specifies the minimum number of character sets that the password must contain.

trans-unit.source: The four character sets are:
trans-unit.target: The four character sets are:

trans-unit.source: Lowercase letters
trans-unit.target: Lowercase letters

trans-unit.source: Uppercase letters
trans-unit.target: Uppercase letters

trans-unit.source: Symbols
trans-unit.target: Symbols

trans-unit.source: Numbers: Setting a higher number for this setting will require users to create passwords that are more complex.
trans-unit.target: Numbers: Setting a higher number for this setting will require users to create passwords that are more complex.

trans-unit.source: For devices that are accessed with a Microsoft Account, the compliance policy will fail to evaluate correctly if **Minimum password length** is greater than 8 characters or if **Minimum number of character sets** is more than 2 characters.
trans-unit.target: For devices that are accessed with a Microsoft Account, the compliance policy will fail to evaluate correctly if **Minimum password length** is greater than 8 characters or if **Minimum number of character sets** is more than 2 characters.

trans-unit.source: **Minutes of inactivity before password is required:** - Supported on Windows RT, Windows RT 8.1, and Windows 8.1
trans-unit.target: **Minutes of inactivity before password is required:** - Supported on Windows RT, Windows RT 8.1, and Windows 8.1

trans-unit.source: Specify the idle time before the user must re-enter their password.
trans-unit.target: Specify the idle time before the user must re-enter their password.

trans-unit.source: **Password expiration (days):** -Supported on Windows RT, Windows RT 8.1, and Windows 8.1.
trans-unit.target: **Password expiration (days):** -Supported on Windows RT, Windows RT 8.1, and Windows 8.1.

trans-unit.source: Select the number of days before the user’s password expires and they must create a new one.
trans-unit.target: Select the number of days before the user’s password expires and they must create a new one.

trans-unit.source: **Remember password history:** - Supported on Windows RT, Windows RT, and Windows 8.1.
trans-unit.target: **Remember password history:** - Supported on Windows RT, Windows RT, and Windows 8.1.

trans-unit.source: Use this setting in conjunction with **Prevent reuse of previous passwords** to restrict the user from creating previously used passwords.
trans-unit.target: Use this setting in conjunction with **Prevent reuse of previous passwords** to restrict the user from creating previously used passwords.

trans-unit.source: **Prevent reuse of previous passwords:** - Supported on Windows RT, Windows RT 8.1, and Windows 8.1
trans-unit.target: **Prevent reuse of previous passwords:** - Supported on Windows RT, Windows RT 8.1, and Windows 8.1

trans-unit.source: If **Remember password history:** is selected, specify the number of previously used passwords that cannot be re-used.
trans-unit.target: If **Remember password history:** is selected, specify the number of previously used passwords that cannot be re-used.

trans-unit.source: Device health settings
trans-unit.target: Device health settings

trans-unit.source: **Require devices to be reported as healthy:** - Supported on Windows 10 devices.
trans-unit.target: **Require devices to be reported as healthy:** - Supported on Windows 10 devices.

trans-unit.source: You can set a rule to require that Windows 10 devices must be reported as healthy in new or existing Compliance Policies.
trans-unit.target: You can set a rule to require that Windows 10 devices must be reported as healthy in new or existing Compliance Policies.

trans-unit.source: If this setting is enabled, Windows 10 devices are evaluated via the Health Attestation Service (HAS) for the following data points:
trans-unit.target: If this setting is enabled, Windows 10 devices are evaluated via the Health Attestation Service (HAS) for the following data points:

trans-unit.source: **BitLocker is enabled:** When BitLocker is on, the device is able to protect data that is stored on the drive from unauthorized access, when the system is turned off or goes to hibernation.
trans-unit.target: **BitLocker is enabled:** When BitLocker is on, the device is able to protect data that is stored on the drive from unauthorized access, when the system is turned off or goes to hibernation.

trans-unit.source: Windows BitLocker Drive Encryption encrypts all data stored on the Windows operating system volume.
trans-unit.target: Windows BitLocker Drive Encryption encrypts all data stored on the Windows operating system volume.

trans-unit.source: BitLocker uses the TPM to help protect the Windows operating system and user data and helps to ensure that a computer is not tampered with, even if it is left unattended, lost, or stolen.
trans-unit.target: BitLocker uses the TPM to help protect the Windows operating system and user data and helps to ensure that a computer is not tampered with, even if it is left unattended, lost, or stolen.

trans-unit.source: If the computer is equipped with a compatible TPM, BitLocker uses the TPM to lock the encryption keys that protect the data.
trans-unit.target: If the computer is equipped with a compatible TPM, BitLocker uses the TPM to lock the encryption keys that protect the data.

trans-unit.source: As a result, the keys cannot be accessed until the TPM has verified the state of the computer
trans-unit.target: As a result, the keys cannot be accessed until the TPM has verified the state of the computer

trans-unit.source: **Code integrity is enabled:** Code integrity is a feature that validates the integrity of a driver or system file each time it is loaded into memory.
trans-unit.target: **Code integrity is enabled:** Code integrity is a feature that validates the integrity of a driver or system file each time it is loaded into memory.

trans-unit.source: Code integrity detects whether an unsigned driver or system file is being loaded into the kernel, or whether a system file has been modified by malicious software that is being run by a user account with administrator privileges.
trans-unit.target: Code integrity detects whether an unsigned driver or system file is being loaded into the kernel, or whether a system file has been modified by malicious software that is being run by a user account with administrator privileges.

trans-unit.source: **Secure Boot is enabled:** When Secure Boot is enabled, the system is forced to boot to a factory trusted state.
trans-unit.target: **Secure Boot is enabled:** When Secure Boot is enabled, the system is forced to boot to a factory trusted state.

trans-unit.source: Also, when Secure Boot is enabled, the core components used to boot the machine must have correct cryptographic signatures that are trusted by the organization that manufactured the device.
trans-unit.target: Also, when Secure Boot is enabled, the core components used to boot the machine must have correct cryptographic signatures that are trusted by the organization that manufactured the device.

trans-unit.source: The UEFI firmware verifies this before it lets the machine start.
trans-unit.target: The UEFI firmware verifies this before it lets the machine start.

trans-unit.source: If any files have been tampered with, breaking their signature, the system will not boot.
trans-unit.target: If any files have been tampered with, breaking their signature, the system will not boot.

trans-unit.source: **Early-launch antimalware is enabled:** Early launch anti-malware (ELAM) provides protection for the computers in your network when they start up and before third party drivers initialize.
trans-unit.target: **Early-launch antimalware is enabled:** Early launch anti-malware (ELAM) provides protection for the computers in your network when they start up and before third party drivers initialize.

trans-unit.source: For information on how the HAS service works, see [Health Attestation CSP](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn934876.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For information on how the HAS service works, see [Health Attestation CSP](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn934876.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Device property settings
trans-unit.target: Device property settings

trans-unit.source: **Minimum OS required:** - Supported on Windows 8.1, and Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: **Minimum OS required:** - Supported on Windows 8.1, and Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: Specify the major.minor.build number here.
trans-unit.target: Specify the major.minor.build number here.

trans-unit.source: The version number must correspond to the version returned by the winver command.
trans-unit.target: The version number must correspond to the version returned by the winver command.

trans-unit.source: When a device has a earlier version that the specified OS version, it is reported as noncompliant.
trans-unit.target: When a device has a earlier version that the specified OS version, it is reported as noncompliant.

trans-unit.source: A link with information on how to upgrade is displayed.
trans-unit.target: A link with information on how to upgrade is displayed.

trans-unit.source: The end user can choose to upgrade their device after which they can access company resources.
trans-unit.target: The end user can choose to upgrade their device after which they can access company resources.

trans-unit.source: **Maximum OS version allowed:** - Supported on Windows 8.1, and Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: **Maximum OS version allowed:** - Supported on Windows 8.1, and Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: When a device is using an OS version later than the one specified in the rule, access to company resources is blocked and the user is asked to contact their IT admin.
trans-unit.target: When a device is using an OS version later than the one specified in the rule, access to company resources is blocked and the user is asked to contact their IT admin.

trans-unit.source: Until there is a change in rule to allow the OS version, this device cannot be used to access company resources.
trans-unit.target: Until there is a change in rule to allow the OS version, this device cannot be used to access company resources.

trans-unit.source: To find the OS version to use for the **Minimum OS required**, and **Maximum OS version allowed** settings, run the **winver** command from the command prompt.
trans-unit.target: To find the OS version to use for the **Minimum OS required**, and **Maximum OS version allowed** settings, run the **winver** command from the command prompt.

trans-unit.source: The winver command returns the reported version of the OS.
trans-unit.target: The winver command returns the reported version of the OS.

trans-unit.source: Windows 8.1 PCs return a version of **6.3**.
trans-unit.target: Windows 8.1 PCs return a version of **6.3**.

trans-unit.source: If the OS version rule is set to Windows 8.1 for Windows, then the device is reported as noncompliant even if the device has Windows 8.1.
trans-unit.target: If the OS version rule is set to Windows 8.1 for Windows, then the device is reported as noncompliant even if the device has Windows 8.1.

trans-unit.source: PCs running Windows 10, the version should be set as "10.0"+ the OS Build number returned by the winver command.
trans-unit.target: PCs running Windows 10, the version should be set as "10.0"+ the OS Build number returned by the winver command.

trans-unit.source: For example, it could be something like 10.0.10586.
trans-unit.target: For example, it could be something like 10.0.10586.

trans-unit.source: CA_Win10OSVersion
trans-unit.target: CA_Win10OSVersion
